page.title: 05CUSTOMS LANGUAGE/DIALECT
page.content:
eg.dogs, cats and rabbits. Many people also own small crofts which contain mainly sheep and cows.People still work {peats.}It is a fairly cheap,easy fuel. There are several stages involved from cutting them out of the ground to taking them home to burn. Local traditions and customs are a mixture of{Scandinavian and Scottish } practices,because these people have settled in our area over the centuries.
The local dialect is still very important although there have been many incomers in recent years.Many local words have originated from the { {Scandinavians}who owned{Shetland}up to the 14th century.{Shetland}then changed hands and belonged to{ {Scotland}this meant that the language
